result.execSummary:
The defendant Stuart A. Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine and costs are due as follows: $25.00 is due on or before 04-01-2022 and then $25.00 is due by the first of the month thereafter until paid in full. $15.00 payment plan fee added. 

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stuart A. Taylor

defendant.name: Taylor, Stuart A.
defendant.address: 220 Red Bird Avenue, Wisconsin Dells, WI 53965

records.addlTxt:
1:28 PM Defendant Stuart A. Taylor appeared by video in custody from Sauk County.  Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared in court for Stuart A. Taylor, Attorney Jeri Marsolek appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant agrees and understands to appear remotely. Court finds defendant waives his right to personal appearance. Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to Count 2. Count 1 Dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes. 
 Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Disorderly Conduct contrary to 947.01(1). 
Defendant did exercise his right to allocution. 

Joint recommendation: $100.00 fine plus costs totaling $579.00. 

Court adopts the joint recommendation: Imposes fine plus costs in the amount of $579.00. Pay at $25.00 month starting 4/1/22 first of each month thereafter. 
The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment. 30 days to submit DNA.
Faxed copy of Notice of Hearing and Zoom information to Sauk County Jail for 2-21-2022 Hearing.

Plea/sentencing hearing on February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

YOU MAY APPEAR EITHER IN PERSON OR BY ZOOM UNLESS ORDERED OTHERWISE BY THE COURT.
